intro: Gireoudia setulosa, commonly known as the hairy gireoudia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and hairy stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studies in plant morphology and ecological adaptation.
